result.execSummary:
The defendant Deonte N Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution ordered in the stipulated amount of $849.00 payable to Julio O.- bail to apply.

Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period. 
Court ordered monies taken by the Department of Correction from up to 25% of prison funds; DOC to collect.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.   Any amount not paid to result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
Obtain GED/HSED.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No gang affiliation.
No Contact with Julio O. or his family.

Mental health assessment; treatment, if needed.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
AODA assessment; treatment, if needed. Urine screens.

Defendant Deonte N Reed in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

/from Attorney Voss to the court dated 4/08/15, filed.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Deonte N Reed in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Ron Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Timothy Keller-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/6/15.

15RM016735  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-31-15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Julio O.; 1200 Block of S 17th Street.; Milwaukee, WI or "B" and B's Friend (Defendant admitted he committed this Armed Robbery with these two)

Defendant Deonte N Reed in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Deonte N Reed in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
